intro: Dombeya befotakensis subsp. befotakensis, commonly known as the Malagasy dombeya, is a shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant features simple, alternate leaves with a rough texture and a distinctive scent. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
